messages.content:

| Item Name | Partner | Deal Value |

| Follow-up Meeting - Circle (USDC) - Contract review and closing | Circle (USDC) | $25,000 |
| Follow-up Email - Circle (USDC) - Quote follow-up | Circle (USDC) | $12,000 |
| Initial Call - Tether (USDT) - Needs assessment | Tether (USDT) | $18,000 |
| Demo Session - Tether (USDT) - Product walkthrough | Tether (USDT) | $18,000 |
| Contract Negotiation - Tether (USDT) - Terms finalization | Tether (USDT) | $18,000 |
| Product Demo - Paxos - Feature demonstration | Paxos | $40,000 |
| Proposal Meeting - Paxos - Final terms discussion | Paxos | $40,000 |
| Check-in Call - MakerDAO - Project status update | MakerDAO | $15,000 |
| Strategy Session - MakerDAO - Q1 planning meeting | MakerDAO | $15,000 |
| Closing Call - Frax Finance - Final approval pending | Frax Finance | $30,000 |
| Product Demo - TrustToken (TrueFi) - Technical demonstration | TrustToken (TrueFi) | $28,000 |
| Strategy Call - Reserve Protocol - Partnership opportunity | Reserve Protocol | $20,000 |
| Initial Meeting - Ampleforth - Project scoping | Ampleforth | $50,000 |
| Contract Discussion - Ampleforth - Deal finalization | Ampleforth | $50,000 |

## Complete Board Summary (All Items)

| Item Name | Partner | Deal Value |
|-----------|---------|------------|
| Discovery Call - Circle (USDC) - Initial requirements gathering | Circle (USDC) | $25,000 |
| Follow-up Meeting - Circle (USDC) - Contract review and closing | Circle (USDC) | $25,000 |
| Product Demo - Paxos - Feature demonstration | Paxos | $40,000 |
| Proposal Meeting - Paxos - Final terms discussion | Paxos | $40,000 |
| Check-in Call - MakerDAO - Project status update | MakerDAO | $15,000 |
| Strategy Session - MakerDAO - Q1 planning meeting | MakerDAO | $15,000 |
| Initial Call - Tether (USDT) - Needs assessment | Tether (USDT) | $18,000 |
| Demo Session - Tether (USDT) - Product walkthrough | Tether (USDT) | $18,000 |
| Contract Negotiation - Tether (USDT) - Terms finalization | Tether (USDT) | $18,000 |
| Discovery Meeting - Binance - Requirements review | Binance | $35,000 |
| Follow-up Call - Binance - Implementation timeline | Binance | $35,000 |
| Proposal Review - Gemini - Pricing discussion | Gemini | $22,000 |
| Closing Call - Frax Finance - Final approval pending | Frax Finance | $30,000 |
| Product Demo - TrustToken (TrueFi) - Technical demonstration | TrustToken (TrueFi) | $28,000 |
| Strategy Call - Reserve Protocol - Partnership opportunity | Reserve Protocol | $20,000 |
| Initial Meeting - Ampleforth - Project scoping | Ampleforth | $50,000 |
| Contract Discussion - Ampleforth - Deal finalization | Ampleforth | $50,000 |
| Follow-up Email - Circle (USDC) - Quote follow-up | Circle (USDC) | $12,000 |
| Discovery Call - Stripe - Payment infrastructure integration | Stripe | $45,000 |

## Key Insights:

**Stablecoin Partners Identified:**
- Circle (USDC) - 3 items, total value: $62,000
- Tether (USDT) - 3 items, total value: $54,000  
- Paxos - 2 items, total value: $80,000
- MakerDAO - 2 items, total value: $30,000
- Frax Finance - 1 item, value: $30,000
- TrustToken (TrueFi) - 1 item, value: $28,000
- Reserve Protocol - 1 item, value: $20,000
- Ampleforth - 2 items, total value: $100,000

**Total Stablecoin Deal Value:** $404,000

The board contains 19 total items, with 15 items (79%) being stablecoin-related, representing significant business focus on the stablecoin ecosystem.

tools.description: Get items by board id and term
tools.name: get_board_items_by_name

tools.description: Create a new item in a monday.com board

boardId.description: The id of the board to which the new item will be added

columnValues.description: A string containing the new column values for the item following this structure: {\"column_id\": \"value\",... you can change multiple columns at once, note that for status column you must use nested value with 'label' as a key and for date column use 'date' as key} - example: "{\"text_column_id\":\"New text\", \"status_column_id\":{\"label\":\"Done\"}, \"date_column_id\":{\"date\":\"2023-05-25\"},\"dropdown_id\":\"value\", \"phone_id\":\"123-456-7890\", \"email_id\":\"test@example.com\"}"

groupId.description: The id of the group id to which the new item will be added, if its not clearly specified, leave empty

name.description: The name of the new item to be created, must be relevant to the user's request

tools.name: create_item

tools.description: Create a new update in a monday.com board

body.description: The update to be created, must be relevant to the user's request

itemId.description: The id of the item to which the update will be added

tools.name: create_update

tools.description: Get board activity logs for a specified time range (defaults to last 30 days)

boardId.description: The id of the board to get activity for

fromDate.description: Start date for activity range (ISO8601DateTime format). Defaults to 30 days ago

toDate.description: End date for activity range (ISO8601DateTime format). Defaults to now

tools.name: get_board_activity

tools.description: Get comprehensive board information including metadata, structure, owners, and configuration

boardId.description: The id of the board to get information for

tools.name: get_board_info

tools.description: Get users, can be filtered by name or partial name

name.description: The name or partial name of the user to get

tools.name: get_users_by_name

boardDescription.description: The description of the board to create

boardKind.description: The kind of board to create

boardName.description: The name of the board to create

workspaceId.description: The ID of the workspace to create the board in

tools.description: Create a new column in a monday.com board

boardId.description: The id of the board to which the new column will be added

columnDescription.description: The description of the column to be created

columnSettings.description: The default values for the new column (relevant only for column type 'status' or 'dropdown') when possible make the values relevant to the user's request

columnTitle.description: The title of the column to be created

columnType.description: The type of the column to be created

tools.name: create_column

tools.description: Execute any Monday.com API operation by generating GraphQL queries and mutations dynamically. Make sure you ask only for the fields you need and nothing more. When providing the query/mutation - use get_graphql_schema and get_type_details tools first to understand the schema before crafting your query.

query.description: Custom GraphQL query/mutation. you need to provide the full query / mutation

variables.description: JSON string containing the variables for the GraphQL operation

tools.name: all_monday_api

tools.description: Fetch the Monday.com GraphQL schema structure including query and mutation definitions. This tool returns available query fields, mutation fields, and a list of GraphQL types in the schema. You can filter results by operation type (read/write) to focus on either queries or mutations.

operationType.description: Type of operation: "read" for queries, "write" for mutations

tools.name: get_graphql_schema

tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific GraphQL type from the Monday.com API schema

typeName.description: The name of the GraphQL type to get details for

tools.name: get_type_details

tools.description:
Get a collection of monday.com documents with their content as markdown. 

PAGINATION: 
- Default limit is 25 documents per page
- Use 'page' parameter to get additional pages (starts at 1)
- Check response for 'has_more_pages' to know if you should continue paginating
- If user asks for "all documents" and you get exactly 25 results, continue with page 2, 3, etc.

FILTERING: Provide an ID filter object with:
- type: 'ids' for specific document IDs
- type: 'object_ids' for specific document object IDs  
- type: 'workspace_ids' for all docs in specific workspaces
- values: array of ID strings (at least 1 required)

Examples:
- { type: 'ids', values: ['123', '456'] }
- { type: 'object_ids', values: ['123'] }
- { type: 'workspace_ids', values: ['ws_101'] }

USAGE PATTERNS:
- For specific documents: use type 'ids' or 'object_ids' (A monday doc has two unique identifiers)
- For workspace exploration: use type 'workspace_ids' with pagination
- For large searches: start with page 1, then paginate if has_more_pages=true

ids.description: ID query object that specifies a type (ids/object_ids/workspace_ids) and an array of values.

type.description: Type of id to query by: ids, object_ids, or workspace_ids

values.description: Array of ID values for this query type (at least 1 required)

limit.description: Number of docs per page (default: 25). Affects pagination - if you get exactly this many results, there may be more pages.

order_by.description: The order in which to retrieve your docs. The default shows created_at with the newest docs listed first. This argument will not be applied if you query docs by specific ids.

page.description: The page number to return (starts at 1). Use this to paginate through large result sets. Check response for has_more_pages indicator.

tools.name: read_docs

tools.description: This tool returns the boards, docs and folders in a workspace and which folder they are in. It returns up to 100 of each object type, if you receive 100 assume there are additional objects of that type in the workspace.

workspace_id.description: The ID of the workspace to get information for

tools.name: workspace_info

tools.description: List all workspaces available to the user. Returns up to 500 workspaces with their ID, name, and description.
tools.name: list_workspaces

folder_id.description: Optional folder ID to place the document inside a specific folder

workspace_id.description: Workspace ID under which to create the new document

column_id.description: ID of an existing 'doc' column on the board which contains the item. If not provided, the tool will create a new doc column automatically when creating a doc on an item.

item_id.description: Item ID to attach the new document to

location.description: Location where the document should be created - either in a workspace or attached to an item

markdown.description: Markdown content that will be imported into the newly created document as blocks.

tools.name: create_doc
